name: Trans*Code
description: The UK’s first ever hack event focused solely on drawing attention to transgender issues and opportunities.
schedule:
Open to trans, non­binary, allies, coders, designers and visionaries, Trans*Code is a groundbreaking two-­day event that aims to help draw attention to transgender issues through a topic­ focused hackday. Supported by introductory programming workshops, community members not currently working in technology are also encouraged to participate.

The install and networking social will takes place on Friday March 27, followed by the main workshop and hackday on Saturday, 28 March.

Why?

Naomi explains: “As technology offers growing opportunities, being sure these opportunities are equally accessible to traditionally marginalised groups grows ever more important. Participants can come from any background, working together to create prototypes around the themes of transgender issues and access to technology. There is a small budget to help support some attendees with travel and lodging, so if you have an idea, can code, can design, want to learn, or want to improve the situation of the trans and non­binary communities through technology, please join us and help make history.”

The event is organised by Trans*Code

.
info: No info, this is a guest event

name: codebar hacks Mondo
description: Join us for a day-long event where you will get to learn more about APIs and use Mondo’s API to bring your ideas to life. The day will include talks, a crash course on APIs and an afternoon full of coding with your team!
schedule:
**9:30-10:00** Kick off event
**10:00-11:00** Talks introducing you to APIs and Mondo's API followed by helping you get setup! 
**11:00-12:00** Crash course on using APIs from the Mondo team
**12:00-13:00** Some delicious lunch!
**13:00-13:30** Four things you can do with Mondo's API
**13:30-17:15** Hack!
**17:15-17:30** Wrapup
**17:30- ?** Drinks
info: To attend as a student, you must be familiar with APIs and version control. There is still time to catch up . You just need to work your way through the API tutorial, and also learn about git and version control in our upcoming workshops.

name: ScotlandJS Talk Proposals Workshop
description:
Do you have a great idea for a 20 minute conference talk?

Have you been wanting to submitting a proposal and always found a reason not to do it?

On Saturday 30th of January at 1pm ScotlandCSS and ScotlandJS are hosting a number of workshops to encourage you to take that next step in submitting a conference talk proposal.

During the workshop you will hear from experienced speakers who have been through similar CFP processes and people who have been part of review committees to find out what makes a great talk proposal.

With the support of mentors and fellow attendees, together, you will start putting together that first proposal.

There are only two things you need to bring with you: a laptop and enthusiasm!

Please read the code of conduct first: http://scotlandjs.com/codeofconduct . Book a ticket at https://ti.to/scotlandjs/london-diversity-cfp-workshop (RSVPs will not be managed via codebar)
schedule: Book a ticket at https://ti.to/scotlandjs/london-diversity-cfp-workshop
info: Book a ticket at https://ti.to/scotlandjs/london-diversity-cfp-workshop

name: uncodebar
description: We run hundreds of workshops a year to help make programming more accessible, but we don't do enough for the coaches who volunteer their time and make these workshops possible. Our first-ever un-conference is an event especially for codebar coaches to come together, share knowledge, and strengthen the community that supports the workshops. Talks will be 30 minutes long, with time allocated for a 15 minute Q&A after.

name: Mind the Code Brighton
description:
Mind the Code is a day-long coding and yoga workshop.  We will be running it as part of the We Spring Forward festival, which is a month long celebration of the role of women in digital culture which runs throughout March, coinciding with women's history month.

The day will be split between talks, self-contained coding exercises in Ruby and Javascript, and yoga and meditation sessions. During all coding sessions, students will be working with coaches on a 1:1 or 2:1 ratio.
All levels of Javascript and Ruby are welcome, including none, and we would recommend taking this opportunity to learn.
schedule:
10:00 - 10:30 Registration & light breakfast
10:30 - 11:00 Talk #1 - Rifa Thorpe-Trace
11:00 - 1:00 Coding workshop #1
12:00 - 12:30 Lunch
1:00 - 1:30 Meditation Session - Leonie Taylor
1:30 - 3:00 Coding workshop #2
3:00 - 3:30 Yoga Session - Leonie Taylor
3:30 - 4:00 Lightning talks
4:00 - 5:00 Coding workshop #3
5:00 - 5:15 Retrospective in large group
5:30  Post-event drinks at Hare & Hounds or Joker (just down the street!)
info: Mind the Code Brighton as part of We Spring Forward

name: Build your own portfolio website
description:
As a web developer, it's important to have your own website. Blogging about your learnings and having a portfolio of work not only gives you a nice record of what you've achieved, it also shows potential employers what you know.

In this workshop, we will use a content and mobile first approach to build a web page that you can take away and use to enhance your own web presence. You can choose between a portfolio page and a blog page (examples will be provided). 

We will begin by adding the content and writing HTML. Then we will move onto CSS. We will also build our own grid system for the layout and add media queries for each component, making sure they are tested in different screen sizes.
Some knowledge of HTML and CSS is required and beginners are welcome.

Students and coaches can sign up for free tickets here: https://ti.to/clearleft/build-your-own-portfolio-website
schedule:
9:45: Arrive
10:00: Start
10:00 - 12:30: Content and HTML, CSS foundations
12:30 - 13:30: Lunch
13:30 - 15:30: Grids and media queries
15:30: Finish
info: Sign up on Tito: https://ti.to/clearleft/build-your-own-portfolio-website

name: Android Development Workshop
description:
Please join us for a very special evening of Android development! This workshop will be following a curriculum developed by Amal Kakaiya, and led by Jez Stevens, Danielle Vass, Amal, and a team of capable codebar coaches. The content will be aimed at beginners to mobile and Android development, but all levels are welcome.

Please come prepared with your laptop, Android Studio installed (this includes opening it up and running it), and if possible, bring an Android device. We will also have some extra devices available to borrow.

We are looking for coaches with Android development experience. If you're on Slack (or want to join), send a message to @kriszta or @daniellevass for more information.

Students -- to attend this workshop, some basic knowledge of HTML and JS is beneficial but not necessary. If there are no spots left, please email london@codebar.io to join the waitlist. Please *DO NOT* RSVP as a coach.
schedule:
18:30 - 19:00 Arrivals & food

19:00 - 21:00 Workshop!
info: Info

name: How to Land Your First Developer Role
description:
Are you a student who has been coming to codebar for a while, but feel unsure about how to land your first junior developer role? Or maybe you haven't been coming too long, but you know that you want to make a career switch? This workshop is for you!

We are running a special evening event for you to learn how to land your first junior dev role. Come get your CV reviewed, learn the ins and outs of interviewing, and practice nailing tech tests with the help of mentors who have worked on the other side of technical recruiting. Food and drinks will be provided.

If you are a coach and have some experience with hiring and you want to help out, please do not RSVP here as a student! Instead, please email us: london@codebar.io
schedule:
During the first hour, there will be four different stations, and all participants will cycle through them in randomly-assigned groups. The stations are TBC, but will include interview skills, CV review, and tech testing. During the second hour, you can revisit any of the stations that you want to focus on.

18:30 - 19:00: Pizza & Drinks
19:00 - 20:00: 15-min lightning workshop sessions
20:00 - 21:00: Hands-on sessions
info: TBD

The tables are:

Interview tips
Tech test tips

name: uncodebar 2
description:
We're very excited to announce ROUND TWO of our very successful unconference, uncodebar 2: Bigger, Better, and More Absorbent.

Click here for online version of day's schedule.

What is this?

We're not putting out a Call For Papers or planning any of the content in advance. Or, at all, really. In order for this day to be successful, we're counting on YOU to make some amazing sessions happen. This is a 100% participant-driven event: we're going to suggest times and spaces, and in the morning, you'll pitch sessions and snag slots on the schedule.

What kinds of sessions should I prepare?

Well, we're all here because we have a passion for software development, mentoring, and community. It would be awesome to have sessions related to any of those -- last year, we had an introduction to D3.js, a workshop on Arduinos, a demo on making music with functional programming, an interactive retrospectives discussion, and many more. But, if you really want to pitch a session on something else entirely, you're more than welcome to. This event is what we make of it -- the org team will just be present to make sure you're engaged, entertained, and well-fed and well-watered.

This is first and foremost a celebration of the efforts of the codebar coaches who have donated countless hours of mentorship over the years. We're opening it up to codebar students and friends as well, but we're asking for a suggested donation of £10 (minimum £5) so we cover our costs for the day. We're also doing this to minimise no-shows -- it really sucks when people don't turn up to events when there were others who would've wanted that spot. If this is prohibitive for you, please get in touch with us at london@codebar.io and we'll see what we can do.

PS - Please join us on our Slack channel for uncodebar-related discussion!
schedule: TBA
info: Use external booking link.

name: Android Workshop
description:
Join us for a special Saturday workshop in Brighton introducing you to Android mobile app development.

In this workshop you will work through set of tutorials which will introduce you to Android app development. These are suitable for students who have done even a small amount with a programming language like Javascript, Ruby, or Python. If you have done Javascript lesson 2 then you will be fine!

This will be a great workshop for students who are becoming comfortable with coding, but want to see what possibilities there are beyond building websites.

We ask that all students run through the setup process for Android Studio on their laptop before attending the event by following this guide. This is because it is a fairly large download and if you wait until the event it will take you awhile to get set up and could cause problems with the internet for others. If you get stuck with the setup, get as far as you can and a coach will be happy to help on the day.

We are also looking for coaches with Android development experience. If you're on Slack (or want to join), send a message to @matt or email him on hello@mattoakes.net for more information.

If you've any dietary requirements please email us at brighton@codebar.io as lunch and snacks will be provided.
schedule:
The event will run on Saturday 17th June at 68 Middle Street. To give you an idea what to expect, here's the day's agenda:

10:00 - 10:30: Arrival and tea/coffee.
10:30 - 11:00: Introductory presentation about Android and to the tutorials.
11:00 - 13:00: Students work with their coaches on the first tutorial.
13:00 - 14:00: Provided lunch, on the beach if the weather is kind to us.
14:00 - 16:00: Students continue working on tutorials with their coaches.
info: We are also looking for coaches with Android development experience. If you're on Slack (or want to join), send a message to @matt or email me on hello@mattoakes.net for more information.

name: micro:bit workshop
description:
The micro:bit is a tiny computer that has been given to schools in the UK to help teach kids to code, and it has had us at codebar Oxford very excited! The tiny £12 chip packs in an LED grid, two buttons, an accelerometer, a compass and a radio antenna, as well as space to connect a wide range of added accessories.

We will be running a workshop for beginners where you will create Python programs that control the various components, with the help of our dedicated coaches. The day will start with focussed lessons designed to teach you the fundamentals of programming and in the afternoon you will have the opportunity to create your own program and show us what you've done. 

Whether it be rock, paper, scissors, a banana keyboard or a milk carton robot, there's an endless possibility of fun projects with the BBC  micro:bit, and we cannot wait to get playing with them! Breakfast, lunch and refreshments will be provided throughout the day.
schedule:
9:30 - Breakfast and arrival
10:00 - Presentation - Intro to micro:bits 
10:30-12:30 - Session 1 - Programming fundamentals and getting started with the micro:bits
12:00-1:00 - Lunch
1:00 - 1:30 - Lightning talks
1:30-3:30 - Session 2 - Working on projects
3:30 - 4:00 - Voluntary project showcase!
info: Sign up like you would a normal codebar workshop.

name: Intro to React Native
description:
Please join us on Saturday 27th May at Normally Studio for a beginner-friendly Introduction to React Native. This workshop will be led by Formidable Labs Lead Engineer Jani Eväkallio, who will guide you through building your own “Snapchat” app.

This workshop will not be in the normal 2:1 ratio format and is not just for codebar students, coaches are able to attend too. Jani will be at the front teaching whilst people follow along, therefore previous experience with JavaScript is required as this will not be covered.

If you have an questions please send us an email london@codebar.io. or if you are on our Slack (or want to join), send a message to @karadelamarck or @kimberleycook. And if there are no spots left, please email london@codebar.io to join the waitlist.
schedule:

11 - Start
1pm - Lunch break
4pm - Finish

name: uncodebar 3
description:
uncodebar, the codebar unconference is back! Now in it's third year, uncodebar is our one day event that encourages codebar coaches to come together, share knowledge, and strengthen the community that supports our workshops.

What is this?

uncodebar is an unconference, a loosely structured open space type event emphasizing the informal exchange of information and ideas between participants. We're not putting out a Call For Papers or planning any of the content in advance. In order for this day to be successful, we're counting on YOU to make some amazing sessions happen. This is a 100% participant-driven event: we're going to suggest times and spaces, and in the morning, you'll pitch sessions and snag slots on the schedule.

What kinds of sessions should I prepare?

As this is an unconference, you can decide what type of session you want to run: workshops, talks, discussions, etc are all welcome. Topics can include anything related to web development, software development, game development, learning, mentoring, community, and many more. It would be awesome to have sessions related to any of those -- last year we had sessions ranging from an ‘Intro to Elm’ to ‘Typography for Developers’. We talked about ‘Building Inclusive Teams’ and ‘Apprenticeships and Software Craftsmanship’. We got an ‘Intro to Docker’ and saw a demonstration on how to build ‘IOT Puzzle Gadgets using LISP’. But, if you really want to pitch a session on something else entirely, you're more than welcome to. This event is what we make of it -- the organisers will just be present to make sure you're engaged, entertained, well-fed and well-watered.

This event is primarily aimed at our coaches but students are welcome as well. We would especially like to see sessions from students. If you have an idea for a session but need help developing it, feel free to get in touch with any of the codebar organisers.

All attendees are welcome to join the #uncodebar channel in the codebar Slack to discuss potential sessions and session ideas.
schedule:
09:30 - 10:00 ✍️ Arrivals and registration
10:00 - 10:15 📈 Welcome talk and session pitches
10:15 - 11:00 ⏳ 1st round of sessions
11:15 - 12:00 ⏳ 2nd round of sessions
12:00 - 13:00 🍝 Lunch
13:00 - 14:00 ⏳ 3rd round of sessions
14:15 - 15:00 ⏳ 4th round of sessions
15:15 - 16:00 ⏳ 5th round of sessions
16:00 - 16:30 ☕️ Break
16:45 - 17:30 ⚡️ Lightning talks
17:30 onwards 🍹 Pub for refreshments
info: Use the links below to RSVP to the event.
